alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in northern Miami- Dade County. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in the Hialeah area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Opa-Locka, Miami Springs, Medley, Gladeview, Miami International Airport, West Little River, Westview and Virginia Gardens. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
